thread.title: RFU names five-man panel to hold post-mortem into England's World Cup failure
thread.title_full: RFU names five-man panel to hold post-mortem into England's World Cup failure

title: RFU names five-man panel to hold post-mortem into England's World Cup failure
text:
RFU names five-man panel to hold post-mortem into England's World Cup failure 19 Oct 2015 14:31:57 
comments 
Sir Ian McGeechan and Ben Kay will sit on the Rugby Football Union panel appointed to review England's dismal World Cup showing, the governing body has announced. 
McGeechan, the former British and Irish Lions and Scotland coach, and 2003 World Cup winner Kay are among the five men who will conduct the inquest into the failure to reach the knockout stage for the first time in the nation's rugby history. 
Also present is former Football Association chief executive Ian Watmore and Ian Ritchie, who holds the same position at the RFU. Related Sport News
